intro: Eriospermum ophioglossoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf eriosperm, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, producing tiny, wind-pollinated blooms. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
